conclusion: To determine when the two objects are farthest apart, analyze the positions as a function of time.
Object A's velocity is given by the slope of the line segment in the graph.
Object B's velocity is given by the slope of the curve in the graph.
The position of an object is the integral of its velocity with respect to time.
Both objects start from the same initial position at t = 0.
Find positions by integrating velocities from t = 0 to t.
At t = 0, both objects are at the same position.
Positions will diverge based on velocities as time progresses.
Objects are farthest apart when the difference in their positions is maximized.
Positions are farthest apart at the point with maximum difference in positions.
At t = t_3, the position of Object A is greater than the position of Object B.
The two objects are farthest apart at t = t_3.
